page.title: 10UNTREATED MILK IN WEST YORKS
page.content: The popularity of raw untreated 'green top' milk is falling because of periodic health scares. Six milion gallons of milk is produced each day in England and Wales. Three million gallons ends up bottled for domesstic use, but of that only 1% is green top. However, our area is unusuual in that a survey of pupils in school showed that over half still have the untreated milk. This may not be the case for much longer. Much publicity has been given to the health risks and there are moves to ban the milk. Local milk producers are fighting these moves. They claim that green top milk is fresh milk which is better for us because pasteurisation (heat treatment) to kill bacteria, also reduces the nutritional value. Despite their efforts the days of untreated milk seem numbered.
